title: Multiple Fonts?
content:
Hi,

We are trying to id this font and although the closest is Garamond we fill that it could have been re-drawn or the designer used different fonts for different letters.

Thanks,

E.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140830111704im_/http:/typophile.com/files/pikayo_3553.gif)
author: vivirenet

comments.content:
Definitely multiple type styles thrown together here.  
Top serif of the k is kinda off, too.

Almost looks like Goudy mixed with Clearface.

- Lex
